content.title: Brachial Artery Exposure
content.description: Surgical exposure of the brachial artery

key_concepts.details: Medial arm incision along medial bicipital groove
Artery lies between biceps and triceps; median nerve crosses anteriorly
Antecubital fossa incision for distal brachial/bifurcation

content.clinical_significance: Frequently required access site for upper extremity procedures
content.statement: Brachial Artery Exposure is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Procedures that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Brachial Artery Exposure helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Brachial Artery Exposure include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Brachial Artery Exposure.

citations.source: UpToDate. (2024). Brachial Artery Exposure. Wolters Kluwer.
Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
